TI: [Effect of phenazepam and barbamyl on normalization of the sulfhydryl group content of brain tissue following sleep deprivation].
AB: Rats placed into the rotating cylindrical tretbahn (diameter 50 cm, 2.3 r. p. m.) for 24, 48 and 96 hrs developed the sleep deprivation resulting in elevation of SH-group level for over 20% in mesencephalon and diencephalon. The normalizing occurred within 48 hrs. The high level of brain SH-groups in 24-hr sleep-deprived rats changed insignificantly after 12 hrs of resting. The intraperitoneal administration of phenazepam (1 mg/kg) or barbamyl (70 mg/kg) had no effect whereas their combination normalized the SH-groups level within 12 hrs of rest.
TT: Vliianie fenazepama i barbamila na normalizatsiiu soderzhaniia sul'fgidril'nykh grupp v tkani mozga krys posle lisheniia sna.
TA: Fiziol Zh SSSR Im I M Sechenova
JT: Fiziologicheskii zhurnal SSSR imeni I. M. Sechenova
SO: Fiziol Zh SSSR Im I M Sechenova. 1981 Jul;67(7):978-82.
